law.catch_line: On application of the person responsible for paying the Maryland estate tax and subject to § 13-601...

text.section: On application of the person responsible for paying the Maryland estate tax and subject to § 13-601 of this article, the Comptroller may allow an alternative payment schedule for the Maryland estate tax, notwithstanding any payment extension under § 6166 of the Internal Revenue Code.

The payment schedule may be in the form of:
a payment deferral; or
an installment payment plan.

section.section:
For each alternative payment schedule allowed under subsection (a) of this section, the Comptroller shall specify the procedures and guidelines, including:
conditions of eligibility; and
amount and duration of any payment deferral; or
amount of and scheduled time for any installment payments.
If the Comptroller denies an application for an alternative payment schedule, the Comptroller shall mail a notice of the denial to the applicant.

text.section: If an alternative payment schedule is allowed under subsection (a) of this section, the person responsible for filing the Maryland estate tax return under § 7-305 of this subtitle shall pay the tax in accordance with the schedule.
